snippet.textDisplay:
"If you're gonna be a champ, you gotta BE the champ."

Reyes was too explosive and expended too much energy; Jones maintained the same pace, taking every KO-worthy strike throughout the match. I mean, no matter how strong your punch is, what purpose does it serve if you don't suppress the threat?

"If it was a fight to the death..."
This statement should justify the win. You can't be throwing out everything you got, and then fuck off before the fight is over; you're still in the ring! Knowing this, Jones conserved his energy in order to capitalize on Reyes' prolonged, intense aggression.

Reyes still had the KO power, but was too tired to perform as well as in earlier rounds.

This is what differentiates a contender from a champion. Reyes posed a bigger threat, at first, when compared to Jones' mellow aggression, but that mellow aggression would prove to outperform an exhausted Reyes.

TL;DR - Jones was consistent; Reyes exhibited progressively dwindling energy.
snippet.textOriginal:

This statement should justify the win. You can't be throwing out everything you got, and then fuck off before the fight is over; you're still in the ring! Knowing this, Jones conserved his energy in order to capitalize on Reyes' prolonged, intense aggression.

Reyes still had the KO power, but was too tired to perform as well as in earlier rounds.

This is what differentiates a contender from a champion. Reyes posed a bigger threat, at first, when compared to Jones' mellow aggression, but that mellow aggression would prove to outperform an exhausted Reyes.

TL;DR - Jones was consistent; Reyes exhibited progressively dwindling energy.

snippet.textDisplay: If the fight was to the death, it also would have started differently. Not saying that I know who would have won, but because each round is rewarded equally on the scorecards, this affects how it plays out greatly (fighters modulate their efforts accordingly instead of immediately trying to kill each other or using a different tactic). I feel like 3 rounds to 2, especially if damage is being done in all 3 of those rounds , should result in a win, but that’s just me. I mean, people can rally in the last 2 rounds because they know they only have to go that long, so I don’t get the prioritization.
snippet.textOriginal: If the fight was to the death, it also would have started differently. Not saying that I know who would have won, but because each round is rewarded equally on the scorecards, this affects how it plays out greatly (fighters modulate their efforts accordingly instead of immediately trying to kill each other or using a different tactic). I feel like 3 rounds to 2, especially if damage is being done in all 3 of those rounds , should result in a win, but that’s just me. I mean, people can rally in the last 2 rounds because they know they only have to go that long, so I don’t get the prioritization.

snippet.authorDisplayName: Barry R. Irving a.k.a. Dean Story Master
snippet.textDisplay:
...MOT FANS AND PEOPLE JUDGING THE FIGHT **NEVER** TALKED ABOUT RING GENERALSHIP WHICH WAS CLEARLY JONS. WORSE STILL IS THE FACT THAT MOST REDUCE THE CHAMPS STATUS TO MONEY EARNED AND HAVING THE TROPHY BELT TO HOLD. WHAT ABOUT HIS LEVEL OF EXCELLENCE FROM TE BEGINNING? THAT HISTORIC LEVEL OF ACCOMPLISHMENT SHOULD NEVER BE REDUCED TO EUSL FIGHTER STATUS IN A HISTORIC BOUT LIKE THIS. REYES SHOULD HAVE A MORE STRINGENT LEVEL TO REACH. HIS WIN LOSS STATUS IS LOWER AS "CHALLENGER" THAN CHAMP STATUS...THEREFORE THE CHALLENGER HAS MORE TO ACCOMPLISH IN TOPPLING A HISTORY MAKING CHAMP. AFFECT ONLY MEANS ENTERTAINMENT...THE CHAMP SHOULD BE GIVEN "EVERY" ANGLE OF SUBJECTIVE CONSIDERATION IN HIS FAVOR FOR ACHIEVING AND KEEPING A LEVEL OF EXCELLENCE....I BELIEVE THAT THE 4 -1 SCORE REFLECTS THAT TYPE OF CONSIDERATION.


I BELIEVE THAT THAT JUDGE REDUCED THE AFFECT IN REYES'S ATTEMPTS AND ONLY SCORED "CLEAN CONTACT".

snippet.textDisplay: This point of view "if they fought untill death is just stupid" and if that is the way how we should have a winner, then why score rounds at all. Fighters didnt invented that way of scoring, organisers did it, so if someone won 3 rounds like Reyes thought he did, i dont see anything wrong in his strategy to not risk it and hang around in last two rounds, it is loophole in the rules and he is not the only one who is doing it. I mean, even Jon Jones went for takedown because he was kinda desperate for points and he got those points altough Reyes defended and went back up quite fast, so if you are picky, you always have that other side of the coin. That is how upsets in professional sports happens, by not being on top of the game whole time if you are considered the best. I know it's not similar, but imagine underdog winning 3:0 in football and after 90 minutes final score is 3:2 for underdog, but judges gave win to favorites just because they played better football in last 30 minutes and if game was supposed to last 3 days, they would win it LOL
snippet.textOriginal: This point of view "if they fought untill death is just stupid" and if that is the way how we should have a winner, then why score rounds at all. Fighters didnt invented that way of scoring, organisers did it, so if someone won 3 rounds like Reyes thought he did, i dont see anything wrong in his strategy to not risk it and hang around in last two rounds, it is loophole in the rules and he is not the only one who is doing it. I mean, even Jon Jones went for takedown because he was kinda desperate for points and he got those points altough Reyes defended and went back up quite fast, so if you are picky, you always have that other side of the coin. That is how upsets in professional sports happens, by not being on top of the game whole time if you are considered the best. I know it's not similar, but imagine underdog winning 3:0 in football and after 90 minutes final score is 3:2 for underdog, but judges gave win to favorites just because they played better football in last 30 minutes and if game was supposed to last 3 days, they would win it LOL

snippet.textDisplay: Ok.. this is important to say... Reyes fought hard in the first 3 Rds because he knew it was a 5 round fight.. he knew if he didn’t finish Jon he could weather the next 2 rounds... no different than Jon Jones reserving his energy and fighting evasively for the first 2 rounds so he has the energy to weather the last 2 rounds... To fight Jon in the octagon everyone knows they have to start strong against Jon... that being said.. in a street fight.. no rounds.. no refs.. no judges.. Jon wouldn’t preserve his energy, Jon would bang and let loose like there is no time limit.. saying Jon would beat him if the fight continued is ridiculous.. if Reyes planned for a fight with no time limit he too would have fought differently. I respect Joe and Rashad a lot, but this is 2 UFC commentators doing damage control favoring Jon,  plus Rashad also partnering with Travis who works with Jackson/Wink and being friends with Jon, Is blatantly obvious to me as nothing more than keeping up appearances for their financial best interests.
snippet.textOriginal: Ok.. this is important to say... To fight Jon in the octagon everyone knows they have to start strong against Jon... that being said.. in a street fight.. no rounds.. no refs.. no judges.. Jon wouldn’t preserve his energy, Jon would bang and let loose like there is no time limit.. saying Jon would beat him if the fight continued is ridiculous.. if Reyes planned for a fight with no time limit he too would have fought differently. snippet.textDisplay:
Joe is incredibly biased in this interview. Bringing up totally irrelevant comparisons like school yard fighting, fighting to the death and the so called “championship rounds”. EVERY round is scored evenly no matter what.
What is the point in having rounds at all if the last two were to somehow hold more value?
Reyes out struck Jones in the first 3 rounds. That’s not a guess it’s a fact. The stats clearly show that.
Effective striking is the highest scoring criteria. The judges have clearly screwed up, yet Joe continues to grasp at straws with these ridiculous comparisons that literally have nothing to do with the way MMA fights are scored.
snippet.textOriginal:
Joe is incredibly biased in this interview. Bringing up totally irrelevant comparisons like school yard fighting, fighting to the death and the so called “championship rounds”. EVERY round is scored evenly no matter what.
What is the point in having rounds at all if the last two were to somehow hold more value? 
Reyes out struck Jones in the first 3 rounds. That’s not a guess it’s a fact. The stats clearly show that. 
Effective striking is the highest scoring criteria. The judges have clearly screwed up, yet Joe continues to grasp at straws with these ridiculous comparisons that literally have nothing to do with the way MMA fights are scored.

snippet.textDisplay: A REMATCH JOE between JJ and DR should be a good one. But I think Jon will win again. Why? Because JJ 'understands' what it means to be a champion and what it takes to get there!! D.R. is good! Really good! But I am not convinced he is as mentally strong as J.J.s  No where's near. But he's gonna dust everyone else though. I think now that he's even more afraid of J.Js because he albeit was touching Jon;  Jon took his BEST shots!! His BEST drive! So he may think he has an advantage in a rematch. But so does Jon. I am looking forward to it. Lesson for D.R.  All rematches of those who GOT rematches against JJs ended up in disaster. Just ask DC, just ask Gustafson. And these are two guys who were just as good as D.R. but got destroyed in the rematch. But DR does deserve a rematch.

snippet.textDisplay: I SAID AND SAW the same thing as Jon Kavanaugh. IF there was a R6 or R7 Jon would have done him in. Why? Because Dom Reyes was SPENT! And Jon was not. Also, in that first round, Ken-Flo was right!  A lot of those shots albeit the flurree 'looked' good, a LOT of those shots did not land because J J was bobbing and weaving Joe Frazier style. People just look at the flash! I was looking at what landed. A lot of DOMs shots were glancing blows. Hey I am a retired competitive martial artist and been in the game for decades. Started at the age of 11 and now in my 60's and STILL train and teach. It was a  really good competitive fight that J.J. one. Rashad is right. To BEAT the champ, you have to BEAT The CHAMP!  And DOM should be happy there was NOT a R6 or R7 because he was fading.
snippet.textOriginal: I SAID AND SAW the same thing as Jon Kavanaugh. IF there was a R6 or R7 Jon would have done him in. Why? Because Dom Reyes was SPENT! And Jon was not. snippet.textDisplay: To be the champion you don't have to beat the champion, you just have to be just a little bit better than him. Saying otherwise is dumb. And using the "if this was a fight to the death" analogy is dumb as well. The fighters enter the fight knowing the number of rounds ahead so they can estimate how much energy they can afford to waste at any given time. For example, Lewis went crazy in the last seconds of his fight against Latifi and was completely exhausted gasping for breath when the bell rang. If another 5 minutes was added right there on the spot, Latifi would most likely be able to finish him pretty soon. Does that indicate that Latifi was the winner BECAUSE he would have beat Lewis if that was a fight to the death? Nope. Rogan is a smart guy, I don't understand why he's saying dumb stuff.
snippet.textOriginal: To be the champion you don't have to beat the champion, you just have to be just a little bit better than him. Saying otherwise is dumb. And using the "if this was a fight to the death" analogy is dumb as well. The fighters enter the fight knowing the number of rounds ahead so they can estimate how much energy they can afford to waste at any given time. For example, Lewis went crazy in the last seconds of his fight against Latifi and was completely exhausted gasping for breath when the bell rang. If another 5 minutes was added right there on the spot, Latifi would most likely be able to finish him pretty soon. Does that indicate that Latifi was the winner BECAUSE he would have beat Lewis if that was a fight to the death? Nope. Rogan is a smart guy, I don't understand why he's saying dumb stuff.

snippet.textDisplay: I disagree with Joe's argumentation.  MMA is not a gladiator style duel to death contest.  It is a sport.  If a sports team dominates a contest enough early to win then that is not undone by the other team dominating the end of the match... unless in total they score more points.  MMA, right now, is scored by rounds.  A more reasonable argument, in my opinion, would be that MMA should consider doing a total point system where round wins count less than total points scored.
snippet.textOriginal: I disagree with Joe's argumentation.  MMA is not a gladiator style duel to death contest.  It is a sport.  If a sports team dominates a contest enough early to win then that is not undone by the other team dominating the end of the match... unless in total they score more points.  MMA, right now, is scored by rounds.  A more reasonable argument, in my opinion, would be that MMA should consider doing a total point system where round wins count less than total points scored.

snippet.textDisplay: Nonsensical argument.. "To the death". People would do things much differently, AND how do you observe and measure someone's mindset accurately and compare it against someone else's?? The only way to do that is to actually fight to the death no matter how long it takes. You can't measure sport fighting against actually fighting for your life.
snippet.textOriginal: Nonsensical argument.. "To the death". snippet.textDisplay: 5:48 his mindset? I've been saying for a long time my issue with Jon being called the GOAT is that he has 0 killer instincts to finish. Thiago had 1 leg for like 3/4 rounds refused to push to finish and Dom was GASSED right out in 4th and even more in the 5th in a fight you know you very well could be losing 3 rds. If you dont have urgency to finish a gassed out fighter when u might be mins from losing your belt idk what will
